page.title: 08HISTORY OF BROOKHALL HOUSE
page.content: Brookhall,half km to the North of Boomhall,was built in the 18th century Its former owner was Sir George Hill but Gilliland family have owned it for over 150yrs.It is a magnificent house set out with beautiful gardens and trees with 100_120 acres of farmland. The farming of the land did not start until 1855.Today crops eg.barley and potatoes are grown and are shipped abroad.Most of the land has been let. The interior of the house is a good size but has changed in the last century.Extensions have been built.It has false windows and is now square shaped.The interior is beautifully decorated with curtains and wallpaper made by William Morris.Mr.Gilliland inherited Brookhall from his uncle and his son will inherit it from him.Brookhall will always remain magnificent.
